intro: Polybotrya macbridei, commonly known as the MacBride's orchid, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in forested areas, thriving in humid and shaded environments. Its leaves are elongated and革质 (leathery), while its inflorescence bears small, showy blooms. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its natural range.
